info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 18 at 1:37PM PST until November 18 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Las Vegas NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southern California, including the following county, San Bernardino.
* WHEN...Until 400 PM PST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 137 PM PST, Heavy rain has ended across northeastern San Bernardino County. However...minor flooding is ongoing due to runoff which is affecting low water crossings and washes. Additional rounds of rain remain possible this afternoon and evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mitchell Caverns, Cima, Kelso, Baker, Hole In The Wall Campground, Mid Hills Campground, Black Canyon Equestrian Campground, Essex, Nipton And Ivanpah Roads, Mountain Pass, Nipton and Sandy Valley. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 in California between mile markers 134 and 186. Interstate 40 in California between mile markers 74 and 122. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON
